([[Morocco]]; 1 November 1965) | Largest win = | Largest loss = | Regional name = [[Football at the Summer Olympics|Olympic Games]] | Regional cup apps = 1 | Regional cup first = [[Football at the 1980 Summer Olympics|1980]] | Regional cup best = Quarter-finals ([[Football at the 1980 Summer Olympics|1980]]) | 2ndRegional name = [[Football at the All-Africa Games|All-Africa Games]] | 2ndRegional cup apps = 7 | 2ndRegional cup first = [[Football at the All-Africa Games|1965]] | 2ndRegional cup best = [[Image:Gold medal africa.svg|15px|Champion]] Gold Medal ([[Football at the All-Africa Games|1978]]) }} '''Algeria Olympic football team''' represents [[Algeria]] in international [[football (soccer)|football]] competitions in [[Olympic Games]]. The selection is limited to players under the age of 23, except during the Olympic Games where the use of three overage players is allowed. The team is controlled by the [[FÃ©dÃ©ration AlgÃ©rienne de Football]] (FAF). ==History== Algeria first appeared in the final of the Summer Olympics held in Moscow in 1980.[http://www.fifa.com/tournaments/archive/tournament=512/edition=197131/results/index.html Moscow 1980 - ''fifa.com''] They managed to reach the quarter finals of the tournament. In 2010, the under-23 team won the 2010 edition of the [[2010 UNAF U-23 Tournament|UNAF U-23 Tournament]]. ==Honours== :'''[[Football at the Summer Olympics|Summer Olympic Games]]:''' ::*Best results: Quarter-final ([[Football at the 1980 Summer Olympics|Moscow 1980]]) :'''[[Football at the All-Africa Games|All-Africa Games]]:''' ::*1 Time Gold Medalist ([[1978 All-Africa Games|Algiers 1978]]) :'''[[UNAF U-23 Tournament]]:''' ::*2 Times Champion ([[2007 UNAF U-23 Tournament|Tunisia 2007]]), ([[2010 UNAF U-23 Tournament|Morocco 2010]]) ::*2 Times Runners-up ([[2006 UNAF U-23 Tournament|Libya 2006]]), ([[2011 UNAF U-23 Tournament|Morocco 2011]]) '' in 1978 All-Africa Games & 1980 Summer Olympics, Algeria participate with the A team at this time'' ==Competitive record== {{col-begin}}
